moves.5. Qh5+ g6 6. Nxg6 Nf6 7. Qe5+ Be7 8. Nx: Minimizing losses and securing predominance in center. Black still must play wery carefully.
moves.15. Ng5 Bd5 16. Bf4 Bf6 17. Bxe5 Nxe5 18: Now pawn e6 is the biggest problem for Black.
moves.22. c3 Bc5 23. Re5 c6 24. b4 Be7 25. Rae: Allows to develop pressure on c.
moves.30. Rf5f4 Ba3: Securing square c1 for planned queening and preventing  31. Nd6+.
moves.34. Rf1: Best move possible in this situation. After 34. R:e6 follows 34 ... c1 = Q+, 35. K h2, Q:f4+ and 36 .... Q: d6. But queening is already unavoidable.
